data.title: Guide to the California Asian American Artists Biographical Survey Records
data.text:
Gee, Yun - photocopy of book, "The Paintings of Yun Gee"

Hibi, Hisako - correspondence regarding and transparencies for "Peaceful Painter: Memoirs of an Issei Woman Artist" book

Ito, Miyoko - catalog, copies of materials from Archives of American Art

Scope and Content Note

Includes transcript of Archives of American Art interview.

May's Photo Studio (Yai S. Lee and Isabelle May Lee)

Scope and Content Note

Photocopies of biographical sources; articles; examples of photographs; publication, The Pear Garden in the West.

Miyagi, Yotoku - book, Yotoku Miyagi: Light and Shade of An Immigrant Artist (in Japanese)

Tam, Reuben - photocopies of materials from the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

May's Photo Studio (Yai S. Lee and Isabelle May Lee)

Scope and Content Note

Oversized catalog containing an image by May's Photo Studio.

Nakashima, J.T. (I.T.?)

Photos in the collection of the California Historical Society

Scope and Content Note

Two pages of hand written notes about photos in the CHS collection.

Peter Palmquist's list of studio photographers from With New Eyes exhibition catalog

Scope and Content Note

Spreadsheet list of studio photographers that appearred in the With New Eyes exhibition catalog.

With New Eyes: Toward an Asian American Art History in the West

Scope and Content Note

Exhibition catalog.

With New Eyes: Toward an Asian American Art History in the West

Scope and Content Note

3 audio cassettes related to exhibition, With New Eyes: Toward an Asian American Art History in the West.

With New Eyes: Toward an Asian American Art History in the West

Scope and Content Note

2 audio cassettes related to exhibition, With New Eyes: Toward an Asian American Art History in the West.

Japanese Artists Who Studied in U.S.A. and the American Scene book

Scope and Content Note

Some photocopied pages from this Japanese publication.

Japanese and Japanese American Painters in the United States: A Half Century of Hope and Sufferingbook excerpts translated

Scope and Content Note

Typed translation of chronology and some artists' bios from this Japanese book.

Article "Japanese Artists in New York Between the World Wars" Mitsutoshi Oba

Scope and Content Note

Article downloaded from web.

Artists in California, 1786-1940 by Edan Milton Hughes 1

Scope and Content Note

Info on pertinent artist from this book, continued in next file.

Artists in California, 1786-1940 by Edan Milton Hughes 2

Scope and Content Note

Info on pertinent artist from this book, continued from previous file.

"Art and the Americas" article (1943) art in internment camps

Scope and Content Note

Photocopy of article.

Artists Clubs and Exhibitions in Los Angeles Before 1930 (book)

Scope and Content Note

Photocopies from Nancy Dustin Wall Moure's book.
